alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 3:35AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern New Hanover, southern Pender, southeastern Bladen, central Brunswick and Columbus Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 333 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from Batarora to near Bethel. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Whiteville, Rowan, Hampstead, Chadbourn, Bethel, Lake Waccamaw, Northwest, Sandyfield, Makatoka, Point Caswell, Hallsboro, Hightsville, Long Creek, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Exum, Wilmington International Airport, Southeastern Community College and Murrayville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 402 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 38 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bladen; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
